snippet: Even with a less storied past than baseball, which has long been considered as Cuban as hand-rolled cigars, soccer has made inroads in Cuba in recent years.
abstract: Havana Journal; soccer is making strong inroads in Cuba, where baseball has long been considered the national sport; soccer's popularity surged after Cuban television began broadcasting international matches in 2010, beginning with the World Cup.
lead_paragraph: Even with a less storied past than baseball, which has long been considered as Cuban as hand-rolled cigars, soccer has made inroads in Cuba in recent years.

headline.seo: Soccer Gains in Cuba, Where Baseball Is King
headline.main: Baseball in Their Veins, but a New Ball at Their Feet
headline.print_headline: Baseball in Their Veins, but a New Ball at Their Feet
